page.title: 18Redlynch Questionnaire 1
page.content: A questionnaire was completed by 45 inhabitants of the area.Of these, 13 had themselves attended the village school, one commencing in 1915. Four people had lived in the village more than 50 years.Eleven had lived here between 10 and 25 years.Nine had moved here in the last five years. A question about the age of houses showed that nineteen houses were over 100 years old, four of them being more than 300 years old.Twenty one were less than 50 years old, four being less than 5 years.The majority of houses are brick built and tile roofed but sixteen were consructed in cob or similar material.Some of these have thatched roofs but in some instances the thatch has been replaced with slate.Three houses have some form of wooden construction.
